definition: A definition

LABEL: animal age at vaccination in days
definition: An age range at vaccination that represents the animal age (unit: day) at the time of vaccination.
definition source: He Y, Xiang Z, Todd T, Courtot M, Brinkman R, Zheng J, Stoeckert CJ, Malone J, Rocca-Serra P, Sansone S, Fostel J, Soldatova LN, Peters B, Rutternberg A. Ontology representation and ANOVA analysis of vaccine protection investigation. Proceeding of Bio-Ontologies 2010: Semantic Applications in Life Sciences, ISMB, July 9-10, 2010. Boston, MA, USA. Full length paper. URL: http://www.hegroup.org/docs/ANOVA_Vaccine_usecase_camera.pdf|Todd TE, Tibi O, Lin Y, Sayers S, Bronner DN, Xiang Z, He Y. Meta-analysis of variables affecting mouse protection efficacy of whole organism Brucella vaccines and vaccine candidates. BMC Bioinformatics. 2013, 14(Suppl 6):S3. PMID: 23735014. PMCID: PMC3633026.

LABEL: human age range at vaccination
term editor: Anna Maria Masci, Anthony Huffman, Oliver He
comment: The human age is classified into four categories as Child (0-12 years), Adolescence (13-18 years), Adult (19-59 years) and Senior Adult (60 years and above) which is discussed in the paper. Reference: https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/6416855.

LABEL: female biological sex datum
definition: A biological sex datum that represents the biological sex of an animal (including human) as being female.
example of usage: F' (intended to refer to a female biological sex), 'Female', 'Woman', '0' (intended to refer to a female biological sex)

LABEL: intersex biological sex datum
definition: A biological sex datum that represents the biological sex of an animal (including human) as being intersex.
example of usage: I' (intended to refer to an intersex biological sex), 'Intersex', 'Hermaphrodite', 'Pseudo-hermaphrodite', '2' (intended to refer to an intersex biological sex)

LABEL: male biological sex datum
definition: A biological sex datum that represents the biological sex of an animal (including human) as being male.
example of usage: M' (intended to refer to a male biological sex), 'Male', 'Man', '1' (intended to refer to a male biological sex)

LABEL: challenge dose (unit: CFU)
definition: A challenge dose that is represented with the unit of colony forming units (CFU).
definition source: He Y, Xiang Z, Todd T, Courtot M, Brinkman R, Zheng J, Stoeckert CJ, Malone J, Rocca-Serra P, Sansone S, Fostel J, Soldatova LN, Peters B, Rutternberg A. Meta-analysis of variables affecting mouse protection efficacy of whole organism Brucella vaccines and vaccine candidates. BMC Bioinformatics. 2013, 14(Suppl 6):S3. PMID: 23735014. PMCID: PMC3633026.

LABEL: CFU per spleen
definition: A colony forming unit (CFU) from the sample of mouse spleen.

LABEL: challenge dose
definition: A dose of a virulent pathogen used for a vaccine challenge process.

LABEL: vaccination dose
definition: A dose of vaccine that is used in a vaccination. Vaccination dose may be and may be not the same as the vaccine dose.

LABEL: vaccine dose
definition: A dose of vaccine specified by the vaccine manufacturer, distributor, or a regulatory agent.

definition: A measurement datum that represents the biological sex of an animal. The result can be represented using a discretized digit, for example, 0 = female; 1 = male.

LABEL: titer
definition: A titer (or titre) is a measure of concentration. Titer testing employs serial dilution to obtain approximate quantitative information from an analytical procedure that inherently only evaluates as positive or negative. The titer corresponds to the highest dilution factor that still yields a positive reading; for example, positive readings in the first 8 serial twofold dilutions translate into a titer of 1:256.
definition source: WEB:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titer

LABEL: vaccination coverage
definition: A measure datum that measures the coverage of vaccination in a specific area during a specific time period.
definition source: WEB: http://www.sanofipasteur.com/sanofi-pasteur2/front/index.jsp?siteCode=SP_CORP&codeRubrique=19|WEB: http://www.who.int/immunization_monitoring/routine/immunization_coverage/en/

LABEL: vaccination mouse strain datum
definition: A measurement datum that represents a specific mouse strain used for vaccination. Different strains can be represented using discretized digitals.  For example, 0 = BALB/c; 1 = CD1; 2 = mixed/outbred; 3 = C57BL/6; 4 = OF1; 5 = 129/Sv; 6 = Swiss albino.
definition source: He Y, Xiang Z, Todd T, Courtot M, Brinkman R, Zheng J, Stoeckert CJ, Malone J, Rocca-Serra P, Sansone S, Fostel J, Soldatova LN, Peters B, Rutternberg A. Ontology representation and ANOVA analysis of vaccine protection investigation. Proceeding of Bio-Ontologies 2010: Semantic Applications in Life Sciences, ISMB, July 9-10, 2010. Boston, MA, USA. Meta-analysis of variables affecting mouse protection efficacy of whole organism Brucella vaccines and vaccine candidates. BMC Bioinformatics. 2013, 14(Suppl 6):S3. PMID: 23735014. PMCID: PMC3633026.

LABEL: vaccination route datum
definition: A measurement datum that represents a specific route (e.g., i.p.) used for vaccination. Different routes can be represented using discretized digitals.  0 = IP; 1 = PO; 2 = SC; 3 = IM; 4 = IN; 6 = IG; 7 = IV; 8 = ID.
definition source: He Y, Xiang Z, Todd T, Courtot M, Brinkman R, Zheng J, Stoeckert CJ, Malone J, Rocca-Serra P, Sansone S, Fostel J, Soldatova LN, Peters B, Rutternberg A. PMCID: PMC3633026.

definition: A measurement datum that represents a length of days as the interval between a vaccination and a challenge in a specific vaccine protection study.

LABEL: vaccine effectiveness rate
definition:
A measurement datum that measues the vaccine effectiveness.  It is assessed with respect to prevention of the disease against which the vaccine is given. 
One simple method to estimate vaccine effectiveness is to use routine data on notifications of disease cases in vaccinated and unvaccinatted children and to compare the porportion of cases vaccinated with the vaccine covervage among the same age group in the general population. If p is the proportion vaccinated in the population and c is the proportion of cases reported to be vaccinated, then
VE = (p-c)/p(1-c) x 100%.
definition source: Hadler TC, et al. Immunization in developing countries. In: Vaccines. Editors: Plotkin S, et al. 2008. p1542-71.|WEB: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Influenza_vaccine

LABEL: vaccine protection efficacy datum
definition: A measurement datum that represents a type of vaccine protection efficacy as an outcome of a vaccine protection study. The result can be represented as a digit, for example, 0 = no protection, and 1 = protection (determined by a p-value cutoff).
definition source: He Y, Xiang Z, Todd T, Courtot M, Brinkman R, Zheng J, Stoeckert CJ, Malone J, Rocca-Serra P, Sansone S, Fostel J, Soldatova LN, Peters B, Rutternberg A. Meta-analysis of variables affecting mouse protection efficacy of whole organism Brucella vaccines and vaccine candidates. BMC Bioinformatics. 2013, 14(Suppl 6):S3. PMID: 23735014. PMCID: PMC3633026.

definition: A reduction of colony forming unit that was measured with the unit of colony forming units (CFU) from the sample of mouse spleen.

LABEL: antibody titer
definition: A titer of antibody that shows how much antibody an organism has produced that recognizes a particular epitope, expressed as the greatest dilution ratio (or its reciprocal) that still gives a positive result. ELISA is a common means of determining antibody titers.
definition source: WEB: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antibody_titer

LABEL: colony forming unit
definition: A titer measurement of viable bacterial or fungal numbers. Unlike in direct microscopic counts where all cells, dead and living, are counted, CFU measures viable cells. By convenience the results are given as CFU/mL (colony-forming units per milliliter) for water, and CFU/g (colony-forming units per gram) for soil or other porous material.
definition source: WEB: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colony-forming_unit

LABEL: reduction of colony forming unit
definition: A titer measurement of viable bacterial or fungal numbers. It equals to a reduction of a CFU count from another CFU count. This term is often used as a measurement of a vaccine protection study.

LABEL: vaccination dose (unit: CFU)
definition: A vaccination dose that is used with the unit of colony forming units (CFU).
definition source: He Y, Xiang Z, Todd T, Courtot M, Brinkman R, Zheng J, Stoeckert CJ, Malone J, Rocca-Serra P, Sansone S, Fostel J, Soldatova LN, Peters B, Rutternberg A. Ontology representation and ANOVA analysis of vaccine protection investigation. Proceeding of Bio-Ontologies 2010: Semantic Applications in Life Sciences, ISMB, July 9-10, 2010. Boston, MA, USA. Full length paper. URL: http://www.hegroup.org/docs/ANOVA_Vaccine_usecase_camera.pdf|Todd TE, Tibi O, Lin Y, Sayers S, Bronner DN, Xiang Z, He Y. Meta-analysis of variables affecting mouse protection efficacy of whole organism Brucella vaccines and vaccine candidates. BMC Bioinformatics. 2013, 14(Suppl 6):S3. PMID: 23735014. PMCID: PMC3633026.

LABEL: host disease state datum
definition: A measurement datum that records the presence of a disease process in a host during the implementation of a vaccine study.

LABEL: host sex datum
definition: A biological sex datum that records the biological sex of the target of a vaccine.

LABEL: host age datum
definition: A measurment datum that records  the age of thost.

LABEL: host pregnancy datum
definition: A measurement datum that records to involvement of the host of the pregnancy process.

LABEL: host comorbidity datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the quality of the host to have a comorbidity.

LABEL: host pathogen exposure datum
definition: A measurment datum that  records the presence of a prior infection or immune memory to a pathogen.

LABEL: challenge-killing interval datum
definition: A measurment datum that  records the interval between the vaccine challenge and the sacrifice of the organism during a vaccine challenge.

LABEL: challenge admistration route datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the route of a pathogen challenge occurs in.

LABEL: sacrifice process datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the method of sacrifice (i.e. killing).

LABEL: host adverse event  to vaccine datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the presence or abasence of adverse event in a host in response of some vaccine.

LABEL: assay mesurement datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the measurement of an assay.

LABEL: assay  measurement sample  interval
definition: A measurment datum that records the time point between the start of a first intervention in a planned process and the measurment of a sample.

LABEL: assay type datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the type of assay used.

LABEL: assay analysis tool version datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the version of an analysis tool (software) used for an assay.

LABEL: assay platform datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the type of platform used for an assay.

LABEL: pathogen attenuation datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the utilization of an attenaution process on a pathogen.

LABEL: vaccination frequency datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the number of occurences the host was vaccinated as part of the vaccination process.

LABEL: vaccination interval datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the interval between vaccinations of a host.

LABEL: vaccine target datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the intended target of a vaccine.

LABEL: vaccine vector datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the vaccine vector of a vaccine.

LABEL: vaccine preservative datum
definition: A measurment datum that records the vaccine preservative of a vaccine.
